abstract: Fox’s two-hour encore of last season’s “American Idol” episode featuring songs by Michael Jackson garnered just 4.2 million viewers.
snippet: Fox’s two-hour encore of last season’s “American Idol” episode featuring songs by Michael Jackson garnered just 4.2 million viewers.
lead_paragraph: Fox and NBC continued with Michael Jackson commemorations on Monday night. From 8 to 10 p.m., Fox garnered just 4.2 million viewers for a two-hour encore of last season’s “American Idol” episode featuring songs by the singer, while NBC’s 10 p.m. “Dateline” special, a re-broadcast of Martin Bashir’s famous 2003 interview with the performer, attracted a modest 6.7 million viewers, less than CBS’s rerun of “CSI: Miami” in the hour (8 million), according to Nielsen’s estimates.

headline.main: Monday Ratings: Low Ratings for Jackson Commemorations
